main event: Multiple witnesses observed a bright, fast-moving object descending rapidly in Louisiana on May 15, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as V-shaped or triangular, with a bright ball of light at the apex.
The object was estimated to be about the size of a five-cent piece held at arm's length.
The object moved rapidly from southeast to northwest, with an estimated length of the 'V' or 'contrail' of around 3 miles.
Multiple observers, including a commercial airline pilot and a military pilot, reported the sighting.
Weather conditions were clear with scattered clouds, and there was no reported thunderstorm activity in the area.
sighted object: bright, fast-moving, V-shaped or triangular object with a ball of light at the apex
witnesses: military, civilian, and commercial airline pilot
